intro: Dicranostyles ampla, commonly known as the broadleaf fern, is a species of fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its large, lance-shaped fronds that can grow up to several feet in length. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and has a rhizomatous growth habit. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are typically located on the underside of the fronds. Dicranostyles ampla is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
